newsitem.title: USA: Panax says Sangen won't pursue license.
newsitem.headline: Panax says Sangen won't pursue license.

text.p: Panax Pharmaceutical Co Ltd said on Thursday that Sangen Pharmaceutical Co Ltd would no longer proceed to acquire a license to an inflammation suppression technology.
Panax announced an agreement to merge with Sangen, a drug research company, in January.
The technology, known as the soluble CD14 inflammation suppression technolgy, was developed by Dr. Sanna Goyert, an associate professor at Cornell University Medical Center.
The company said it would no longer pursue the license "because of the early nature of the technology and certain other factors."
In addition, Panax said it had signed a letter of intent to acquire CorBec Pharmaceuticals Inc.
The transaction is subject to several contingencies, Panax said in a statement.
If the contingencies were met, the company said, CorBec shareholders would receive an up-front payment of $750,000 and 750,000 shares of common stock of Panax.
